cards.title: Grafana-ui SegementAsync remote typeahead

issue.title: Grafana-ui SegementAsync remote typeahead
issue.body:
The contract for `SegementAsync` includes a `query` param however I don't think it's supplied anywhere. https://github.com/grafana/grafana/blob/7d6bd78e0b592bcb9e9904a3f222953655019903/packages/grafana-ui/src/components/Segment/SegmentAsync.tsx#L10

Would love to be able to use this for async-typeahead in the case where there are too many results to fetch for the dropdown.

events.body: can you take a look at that?

Hi @seanlaff! That was the idea from the beginning - that SegmentAsync would support lazy async loading, but I never got time to implement that. The query param was apparently never removed. 

I don't have time to add async typeahead right now. If you have time, you can give it a go. If not, I'll do it in a few weeks.

Hey @sunker I tried implementing this today but it looks like react-select does not support lazy-loading _default_ options. 

Clicking on an async-select will render an empty select... and will not fetch anything until the user starts typing (I assume we'd want it to make an async request for `""`). React-select offers us the ability to supply `defaultOptions = true`, but it does the fetch on mount- not menuOpen.

I looked into hooking into the `onMenuOpen` callback, but the acrobatics get pretty crazy and there's not really a way to pass "controlled" options back down into the async select.

I see you guys are using a react-select fork from @torkelo - maybe it's something we can play with there and get upstreamed?

Here's an example I was playing with from their docs that shows the issue https://codesandbox.io/s/react-codesandboxer-example-xojvl

cards.title: Multiple variables cannot be passed into clickThrough url

issue.title: Multiple variables cannot be passed into clickThrough url
issue.body:
I am passing multiple parameters into clickThrough url. Specifically I am trying to pass the variable $service from the dashboard and the cell name that represent name of the specific container. 
This is my clickThrough url I defined:

dashboard/db/docker-host-and-container-overview?var-containergroup=${__cell_name}&var-service=$service used for repeating panels 

It appears that url string is being passed through $sanitize function which converts "&" symbols into & when sanitize switch is turned on. 

The resulting url is:
/d/K5E5flWWz/docker-host-and-container-overview?orgId=1&var-containergroup=apps&var-service=All.

If sanitize switch is turned off, the clickThrough is not working at all.

I am also noticing, that variable $service is not being replaced with the value for the actual panel, but with value "All"

issue.title: Fixes for issues #56, #57, #58, #63, #65 + new feature for issue #55
issue.body:
- #56 [Bug] Legends and Values are not clickable
Replaced on click method by conditional <a> tag and removed pointer events from text to avoid selection. Now tiles with click through link are clickable as a standard link.

- #55 [FR] Adding "Open in new tab" functionality for the clickThroughUrl setting
Added toggle button (in the default, overrides and composites options panels) updating the target to blank/self on the tiles links

- #58 Multiple variables cannot be passed into clickThrough url
Fixed sanitize issue: missing copy in clones/duplicate methods, missing metricNameChanged method in metric_overrides_manager.ts called in html causing refresh not to be called properly upon update.
Fixed ${__cell...} multiple variables replacement, added unit test.

- #63 Missing metric name and value in polygon
Fixed auto-scale font

- #65 Auto Size option for Rows and Columns not always displaying all the hexagons
Fixed Automatic Columns/Rows count + automatic hexagon size

- #57 [Bug] zero Display Limit makes hexagons to disappear 
0 and empty values activate unlimited mode as specified by the tooltip + added hint for unlimited

cards.title: 6.6.0 Azure Monitor data source - cannot enter API Key for Application Insights Details

issue.title: 6.6.0 Azure Monitor data source - cannot enter API Key for Application Insights Details
issue.body:
**What happened**:
I am trying to configure an Azure Monitor data source in a new 6.6.0 installation. However I cannot enter the API Key for Application Insights Details in the last part of the configuration.
I had no problems in previous version 6.4.4

**What you expected to happen**:
To be able to enter the key

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Start create a data source, fill in all necessary parts for Azure Monitor Details and Azure Log Analytics API Details. Press Save & Test
you will get success.
Then try to fill in API Key for Application Insights Details - it does not accept any entering in the field

**Anything else we need to know?**:
newly installed environment

**Environment**:
- Grafana version: 6.6.0
- Data source type & version: Azure Monitor
- OS Grafana is installed on: Windows
- User OS & Browser: Windows & Chrome
- Grafana plugins: N/A
- Others:

events.body: The deprecated Azure Monitor plugin seems to have the same issue https://github.com/grafana/azure-monitor-datasource/issues/121

After some debugging, I've noticed also that the API key gets stored in the DB `data_source` table into the `json_data` property. Not sure if it should have landed in the `secure_json_data` property instead like the other secrets... I've added it there now manually but still, the proxy fails to fetch the data and Application Insights reports that my API key hasn't been used yet. So it seems like the proxy is still not sending it in the headers.
Seems to be possible to enter API Key in 6.6.1

cards.title: CloudWatch metric names with spaces causing queries to fail

issue.title: CloudWatch metric names with spaces causing queries to fail

labels.name: priority/important-longterm
labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed and/or may need multiple releases to complete.

issue.body:
<!--
Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible.
Questions should be posted to https://community.grafana.com
Use query inspector to troubleshoot issues: https://community.grafana.com/t/using-grafanas-query-inspector-to-troubleshoot-issues/2630
-->

**What happened**:
When using the metric picker to display metrics for AWS Managed Streaming Kafka (MSK) service, none of the dimensions work (`Broker ID`, `Cluster Name`). The UI displays a message at the top saying:

```
ValidationError: Invalid SEARCH parameter: {AWS/Kafka,Broker ID,Cluster Name} MetricName="CpuUser" "Cluster Name"="service-prod" status code: 400, request id: 7878b7aa-55eb-4fa4-9297-19d62482eafe
```

After copying the query into CloudWatch, the issue appears to be due to the dimensions have a space in them and not being wrapped in double-quotes.


For example, within CloudWatch this returns values:
```
SEARCH('{AWS/Kafka,"Broker ID","Cluster Name"} MetricName="CpuUser" "Cluster Name"="service-prod"', 'Average', 300)
```

But this does not. Actually causes the page to display `There was an error while trying to get graph data.`
```
SEARCH('{AWS/Kafka,Broker ID,Cluster Name} MetricName="CpuUser" "Cluster Name"="service-prod"', 'Average', 300)
```

**Environment**:
- Grafana version: 6.6.1
- Data source type & version: CloudWatch
- OS Grafana is installed on: Grafana Cloud
- User OS & Browser: Chrome
- Grafana plugins: None
- Others:

events.body:
Thank you for the report.

The bug is that we're not surrounding the dimension with `"` when there's a space in the dimension name? Definitely sounds like something we should fix. If someone from the community would like to beat us to fixing it, the approach I would try would be to make sure that any value in the `dimensionValues` slice in the `*CloudWatchExecutor.handleGetDimensions` method (see code snippet below) that contains a space is surrounded by `"`.
 https://github.com/grafana/grafana/blob/df1d43167af035c6819923ecce135056f37c79c2/pkg/tsdb/cloudwatch/metric_find_query.go#L388

There is a possible workaround: If you manually type the dimension with quotes it should work, can you confirm that? (i.e. instead of picking Broker ID from the dropdown list, write `"Broker ID"` and hit enter).

I assume the problem occurs when Grafana is generating a search expression based on the selections that is made in the query editor. I agree that it's a bug and that it's fairly easy to fix. However the fix should not be done in `metric_find_query.go`, but in `metric_data_query_builder.go`. That's where the search expressions is generated. It would be great if someone from the community could take a stab at this. If not, we'll take a look at this this spring.
Can I pick this up?

Tried to study the code. I'm a bit confused where to fix it. There are two suggestions right now, but not decided yet.

1. `*CloudWatchExecutor.handleGetDimensions` inside `metric_find_query.go`
2. `metric_data_query_builder.go` - I guess it would be the function `buildSearchExpression`... right?

I guess adding double quotes directly to `dimensionsMap` inside `metric_find_query.go` could also work?

https://github.com/grafana/grafana/blob/df1d43167af035c6819923ecce135056f37c79c2/pkg/tsdb/cloudwatch/metric_find_query.go#L125

Which of these would be a proper fix?

cards.title: CloudWatch Datasource: floating bars in graph when stacking is enabled

issue.title: CloudWatch Datasource: floating bars in graph when stacking is enabled
issue.body:
We are using a CloudWatch datasource with a multi-value variable for one dimension:
The single query results in 3 series for that graph:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8142186/74746195-53d71300-5265-11ea-9c8b-f72c3a534e39.png)
As you see in the screenshot, the bar of the last series is floating.

Enabling Lines shows that the bar is actually placed/stacked on top of the line between the other bars:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8142186/74746239-66514c80-5265-11ea-91c8-01dcb5237391.png)

We have already set "Null value" = "null as zero" which should in general prevent this from happening. The problem seems to be that the CloudWatch datasource does not return a null for the intervals where no data is available. 

**Environment**:
- Grafana version: Grafana 6.6.1
- Data source type & version: CloudWatch

cards.title: Azure Monitor - Table View - parsing strings as date

issue.title: Azure Monitor - Table View - parsing strings as date
issue.body:
**What happened**:
Since the upgrade to 6.5, the table view is trying to parse data in the first table as date, no matter what data is provided. Changing the data type to "String" doesn't fix the issue. The panel is showing this type of error:

> parsing time "Internet Explorer 11.0" as "2006-01-02T15:04:05.999999999Z07:00": cannot parse "Internet Explorer 11.0" as "2006"

This was tested using Azure Monitor datasource and the Application Insights service.

Downgrading Grafana back to version 6.4.5 fixed the issue for now.

**What you expected to happen**:
Table view should show data that is sent there as a string instead of trying to format it as a date.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1. Create a table with AI data 
2. Select a value that's not timestamp 
3. Try executing query

**Anything else we need to know?**:
This was tested on Grafana Cloud

**Environment**:
- Grafana version: 6.5.2
- Data source type & version: Azure Monitor 0.3.0

![How it should look like](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56955081/71006248-55f5e780-20e5-11ea-8ee5-93a585b8b0ca.png)
![Broken](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56955081/71006319-78880080-20e5-11ea-82e7-2e0ee7a4efcf.png)

events.body:
Hi,

I was wondering whether there is an update on this issue? Are there any known workarounds, I haven't found any?
Currently I am using Grafana 6.4.3 and this issue prevents us from upgrading to the latest version.

Thank you for any response.
Is there an update on this?

Hi,

Last week I was able to fix this for my environment by making use of a log Analytics workspace and performing the Kusto query there via app("$ApplicationInsightsResourceX").requests. There you can choose for the outcome to be a timeseries or a table. When using table there are no restrictions on the columns.

Example query:
app("$ApplicationInsights_X").requests
| where $__timeFilter(timestamp)
| where success == "False"
| summarize count() by name, tostring(resultCode)
| order by count_ desc

cards.title: Azure Log Analytics query only returning single time series data set

issue.title: Azure Log Analytics query only returning single time series data set
issue.body:
**What happened**:
Azure Log Analytics query from Grafana only returns a single time series data set. Same query in Azure portal returns two data sets.

In this case, new failure rate and existing failure rate should be displayed in Grafana:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1184220/71211669-84bbbb80-22a7-11ea-83c4-8f0dbb8c55ac.png)

Azure:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1184220/71211720-a2892080-22a7-11ea-8cb8-fe25d756cde0.png)

**What you expected to happen**:
Both data sets to be returned and displayed on the Graph Panel.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
* Create Grafana Graph Panel
* Azure Monitor (Log Analytics) data source
* Set Service: Azure Log Analytics
* Copy the below query and replace variables in two locations to replicate. Exact same code works in the Azure Portal under Log analytics. 

```
let timeRange = 1d;
let grain = 30m;
let bigWindowTimeRange = 7d;
let existingFailures = app('/subscriptions/$subscriptions/resourceGroups/$resourcegroups/providers/$namespace/$resourcenames').requests
| where timestamp >= ago(bigWindowTimeRange) and timestamp < bin(ago(timeRange), grain)
| where operation_Name in ('*') or '*' in ('*')
| where name in ('*') or '*' in ('*')
| where resultCode in ('*') or '*' in ('*') or iff('@' in ('*'), resultCode startswith '5', false) or iff('#' in ('*'), resultCode startswith '4', false)
| extend Key = strcat(name, '-', resultCode)
| summarize makeset(Key, 10000);
app('/subscriptions/$subscriptions/resourceGroups/$resourcegroups/providers/$namespace/$resourcenames').requests
| where timestamp >= bin(ago(timeRange), grain)
| where operation_Name in ('*') or '*' in ('*')
| where name in ('*') or '*' in ('*')
| extend IncludeInFailures = resultCode in ('*') or '*' in ('*') or iff('@' in ('*'), resultCode startswith '5', false) or iff('#' in ('*'), resultCode startswith '4', false)
| extend Key = strcat(name, '-', resultCode)
| summarize NewFailures = countif(success == false and Key !in (existingFailures) and IncludeInFailures), ExistingFailures = countif(success == false and Key in (existingFailures) and IncludeInFailures), All = count() by bin(timestamp, grain)
| project timestamp, ['New Failure Rate (%)'] = 100.0 * NewFailures / All, ['Existing Failure Rate (%)'] = 100.0 * ExistingFailures / All
| project timestamp, ['New Failure Rate (%)'], ['Existing Failure Rate (%)']
| order by timestamp asc
```

**Environment**:
- Grafana version: 6.5.2
- Data source type & version: Azure Log Analytics
- OS Grafana is installed on: Ubuntu 18.04
- User OS & Browser: Win10/Chrome

cards.title: Can't connect Application Insights on Azure Datasource

issue.title: Can't connect Application Insights on Azure Datasource
issue.body:
**What happened**: Grafana can't connect to the Application Insights API when adding it as part of an Azure Monitor Datasource. 

![App Insights error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29178880/71661261-a37e7f80-2d88-11ea-8517-7c6ced7b07d6.png)

Application ID and Generated API Keys work fine when making a request to [api.applicationinsights.io](https://api.applicationinsights.io)

There are no issues accessing [api.applicationinsights.io](https://api.applicationinsights.io) on the same machine.

I don't know how to debug the requests the grafana server makes to troubleshoot this further. Looking at the grafana logs after saving the keys, I don't see any requests going to [api.applicationinsights.io](https://api.applicationinsights.io) which is weird...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29178880/71662350-1f2dfb80-2d8c-11ea-8a2c-448fb8436a36.png)

**What you expected to happen**: Clicking "Save & Test" should show success in querying the application insights service, along with Azure Monitor and Log Analytics Service

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1.) Run a Fresh installation of Grafana. (I used v6.5.2)
2.) Login to Grafana and add an Azure Monitor datasource.
3.) Create an App Registration for Azure Monitor. Also generate a Key for this app.
4.) Assign the App Registration a Role such as _Monitoring Reader_ for the subscription.
4.) Under **Azure Log Analytics API Details**, register the IDs together with the Key
5.) Enable "Same details as Azure Monitor API" under **Azure Log Analytics API Details**
6.) Generate an [**Application Insights API Key** ](https://dev.applicationinsights.io/quickstart)
7.) Under **Application Insights Details**, register the Application IDs together with the Key
8.) Click _"Save & Test"_

**Anything else we need to know?**:
I've had this issue on three machines. 
- My local windows pc running Grafana 6.5.2
- An Azure VM running Grafana 6.4.4 w/ docker
- A local linux pc running Grafana 6.4.4 w/ docker

**Environment**:
- Grafana version: 6.4.4 & 6.5.2
- Data source type & version: Azure Monitor Application Insights
- OS Grafana is installed on: Windows and Linux
- User OS & Browser: Chrome 69
- Grafana plugins: None (All Default)

events.body:

Clicking "Save & Test" on my office machine fails with the error.

cards.title: Application Insights Kusto queries do not support $__timeFrom() and $__timeTo() despite documentation instructions

issue.title: Application Insights Kusto queries do not support $__timeFrom() and $__timeTo() despite documentation instructions
issue.body:
Documentation states that we can use `$__timeFrom()` in Azure Application Insights (Azure Monitor) data source custom queries (e.g. using Application Insights, use the text editor, i.e. the small pen icon in the query editor, and try using variables).

`$__timeFilter()` works, but using `$__timeFrom()` and `$__timeTo()` yields a "Metric request error" error. Also, `$__from` and `$__to` work (they provide an epoch value) but they do not give the same values as `$__timeFilter()` (probably due to time zones), which makes `$__timeFrom()` necessary for `make-series` queries.

To reproduce, use this query, which should work in any Application Insights account:

```
requests 
| take 1
| project timestamp, splitOn = "$__timeFrom()", y = $__from
```

**Environment**:
- Grafana version: Grafana v6.5.2 (742d165) (Cloud)
- Data source type & version: Azure Monitor
- OS Grafana is installed on: Cloud
- User OS & Browser: Windows 10, Chrome

cards.title: Support NRQL in variable queries

issue.title: Support NRQL in variable queries
issue.body: The NewRelic plugin doesn't support NRQL in variable queries. That should be a good improvement for this plugin.

events.body: After a lot of testing and back-and-forth with a prospect, I would like to add my +1 to this again. Even though the NewRelic plugin supports template variables, the regex to filter query results don't get interpolated into NRQL, thus making it unusable.
Also adding a +1 from a current Enterprise customer that has also made a request for this.
Also adding a +1 from a prospect who also has a requirement for this. (OpenText)

@Tomica-G : It would also be help if you could attach some additional information about how they have setup their datasource. The logs seem to indicate that an attempt to perform a query, when no query was sent occurred. I'm not sure under what circumstances this would happen, but a reliable way to reproduce the problem would be helpful. Starting with their datasource configuration, and even better, credentials for an account that we could use in reproducing and fixing the bug, because this certainly seems like one :).

The customer provided some more information.

They downloaded a plugin from the site and manually installed it. The error that was reported happened on the datasource configuration page while testing the connection.

They are using the datasource provisioning to add it. One thing they mentioned is that it works fine when running it from a docker container using the provisioning file, there are no errors in that case.

Here is a configuration used to provision the datasource:

```  - name: iService Dev
    type: grafana-servicenow-datasource
    url: https://8451dev.service-now.com
    basicAuth: true
    jsonData:
      basicAuthUser: "svc_pd_grafana"
    secureJsonData:
      basicAuthPassword: "PASSWORD_HERE"
    version: 1
```

And they've sent a screenshot of the datasource configuration page:

![service_now](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56955081/73824367-544dc380-47fa-11ea-9e74-f0b8ee2f4c9a.png)

@Tomica-G , are you sure it's 8451dev? Usually service now provisions dev environments like `dev52340`. Here is my provisioning file:

```
# config file version
apiVersion: 1

deleteDatasources:
  - name: ServiceNow
    orgId: 1

datasources:
- name: ServiceNow
  type: grafana-servicenow-datasource
  enabled: true
  access: proxy
  url: https://dev52340.service-now.com
  basicAuth: true
  basicAuthUser: admin
  jsonData:
    advancedOptions: true
    basicAuthUser: admin
    fieldSearchType: quick
    internalFieldsFiltration: true
    tlsSkipVerify: true
  secureJsonData:
    basicAuthPassword: ############
  version: 1
  editable: true
  isDefault: false

```

@Tomica-G 

I was able to reproduce the problem, I did it with a provisioning file, and docker-compose running 6.5.1. The only fix required was the top line:

apiVersion: 1

Otherwise I got a `metric request error`

The customer provided some more information, shared it on Slack as well. I'll add it here.

Here are screenshots when adding a datasource manually on Grafana instance running on his RedHat server:

![image001 (11)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56955081/74838914-b0e5ce00-5324-11ea-8993-438f0753ee20.png)
![image002 (9)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56955081/74838925-b3e0be80-5324-11ea-82bc-c34018ea4a42.png)

And this is how it looks like running on Docker where the datasources is added by a provisioning fie (it works fine there):
![image003 (5)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56955081/74838971-c5c26180-5324-11ea-8b24-efea76d8d2c9.png)

The customer also said this:

This may have to do with the RHEL server lives within a datacenter that only allows outbound traffic through a proxy that has to be set. The error does sound similar to a proxy error. In the past, weve run into a similar issue with getting this server to get an externally facing Zabbix instance as a datasource. We were able to fix that by setting grafana (the user)s http_proxy,https_proxy to the proxy. It could be that the servicenow plugin is maybe not following that?


@briangann mentioned that we are n to able to handle corporate proxies:
```handling a corporate proxy is on our backlog, this is a known problem across all datasources with a backend```

However, the customer had a similar issue with the Zabbix datasource that he managed to fix, but the same fix doesn't work with the ServiceNow plugin. Do we maybe have any workaround that would help here? It's a $45K ARR customer so it would be great if we could help out.

The customer replied back:
https://grafana.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/8809

```We are setting our proxy settings within /etc/sysconfig/grafana-server

HTTPS_PROXY=https://hdc-proxy.int.8451.com:8080
HTTP_PROXY=http://hdc-proxy.int.8451.com:8080
NO_PROXY=localhost,127.0.0.0/8,10.0.0.0/8,*.8451.com```

That doesn't work for them, although the same configuration works with the Zabbix datasource.
the "Skip TLS Verify" may need to be enabled when using a proxy. Corporate proxies often replace the certificate with their own.
The "Skip TLS Verify" option is already enabled in the datasource configuration, but it doesn't help.

issue.title: Templated alias fields behaviour changed in 6.5 - there is no label if there's no matching data
issue.body:
Following on from https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/20729

On 6.5 we see a difference in behaviour in cloudwatch charts when we have an alias which has no matching data:
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1453591/74522994-2c561280-4f14-11ea-8ee0-06102d3fe712.png)

The same example on 6.4 - note each region has a label, even if there's no data in that region, and there's no weird un-expanded variable:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1453591/74522938-134d6180-4f14-11ea-9411-d917e024e5d5.png)

I've put together a draft pr to fix the issue - it needs more work, but i can complete that if you're happy with the approach:
https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/21974

issue.title: CloudWatch: Expand alias variables when query yields no result

repository.name: grafana
repository.description: The tool for beautiful monitoring and metric analytics & dashboards for Graphite, InfluxDB & Prometheus & More

issue.body:
In case a multi-valued template variable was being used for a dimension value and the query did not yield any result, the GetMetricData api returns one query response with an empty value array. The response doesn't have any details about dimensions and such, and therefore the alias field wasn't expanded correctly. Before Grafana 6.5, the CloudWatch datasource used the GMS api that returned one response per query, even in case the queries didn't yield any values, so therefore expanding the alias field worked fine before Grafana 6.5. 

The PR provides a workaround for this problem. In case a query yields no values and a multi-valued template variable is being used, empty timeseries will be created for each of the dimension values. Those values are then used to expand the alias field. 

 





fixes #22204

cards.title: Make azure cloud instance configurable

issue.title: Make azure cloud instance configurable
issue.body:
AD Auth and kusto resource/context URLs differ depending on which Azure
cloud is being used (global Azure vs sovereign/national clouds), but the
use of a hardcoded AD and kusto resource endpoint prevent the plugin
from working in these environments.  Added two separate configuration
items for AD Auth endpoint and kusto resource/context URL to allow these
to be set to the appropriate value for the Azure cloud being used.

events.message:
Make azure cloud instance configurable

AD Auth and kusto resource/context URLs differ depending on which Azure
cloud is being used (global Azure vs sovereign/national clouds), but the
use of a hardcoded AD and kusto resource endpoint prevent the plugin
from working in these environments.  Added two separate configuration
items for AD Auth endpoint and kusto resource/context URL to allow these
to be set to the appropriate value for the Azure cloud being used.

events.body:
This also addresses #16 

Allowing the URLs and paths to be configurable would also allow the plugin to be used in future instances without needing explicit updates, but it is obviously a little less user friendly than having a dropdown list to choose from.  That said, the need to have the plugin updated for each instance is inconvenient, and if there's ever a future where ADX is on Azure Stack, a custom input would definitely be required, so a custom input seemed to make more sense.

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR fixes an issue in 6.6.0/6.6.1 where existing Azure Monitor sources that have been configured with provisioning fail to authenticate due to a missing authorization header.

Older datasources still expect the `sameasloganalyticsazure` route. Re adding this allows the correct settings to be retrieved and the authorization header is built as expected.

issue.title: 6.6.0 Azure Monitordata source / log analytics authentication error
issue.body:
<!--
Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible.
Questions should be posted to https://community.grafana.com
Use query inspector to troubleshoot issues: https://community.grafana.com/t/using-grafanas-query-inspector-to-troubleshoot-issues/2630
-->

**What happened**:
It would appear that there is a regression in how the authentication request to log analytics is being created.

The data source now gives the following error:

```
www-authenticate: Bearer authorization_uri="https://login.windows.net/3aacc835-4b83-483d-841d-cd787f6f1486", error="invalid_token", error_description="The authentication failed because of missing 'Authorization' header."
```

Mitigation was to rollback to 6.5.1

**What you expected to happen**:
Log Analytics queries should work as per 6.5.x

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
* Upgrade to 6.6.0
* Visit any existing dashboard with log analytics graphs, they will be broken
* Go to data source config, press f12, click test, ensure that you have the log analytics section populated.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Grafana version: 6.6.0
- Data source type & version: Azure Montior
- OS Grafana is installed on: Docker (non ubuntu)
- User OS & Browser: Win 10/ Chrome
- Grafana plugins:
- Others:

rename.from: 6.6.0 Azure Monitor data source / log analytics
rename.to: 6.6.0 Azure Monitordata source / log analytics authentication error

events.body:
I came across the same issue after upgrading my Docker containers (I have not seen the issue on my Windows PC).

The solution I came across yesterday was to toggle "Same details as Azure Monitor API" to off. Enter the duplicate details and then save and test

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47744931/73534800-eb410700-4419-11ea-8f9a-7b72e783265b.png)

I was then able to toggle this back to on and it continued to work.
@stevenXarios Thanks for your reply. We use provisioning for our datasources so I don't think this would be an appropriate work around.  i'll do some investigation though.

Ive done some debugging locally and have fixed the issue. The recent changes by @shavonn dont seem to be backwards compatible with azure monitor data sources configured with provisioning. The fix was to re instate the routing logic that was removed.

While working on this issue I also came across a second bug.

When you enter a previously configured data source, it fails to load the subscriptions and workspace. If you watch the traffic flow you can see that the backend server is displaying an error page. It looks like this is because the logic in the ConfigEditor is not populating the URL property in init.. and therefore missing out the proxy/id portion of the request url.

I spent a few hours on this and couldnt work it out for the life of me. The code flow hits all of the right parts but the props object just doesnt update.

Ill submit a PR for the first issue and am happy to include a fix for the second but might need a few pointers.

events.body:
Done some more digging and am non-the-wiser.

I've pushed a commit here to start some discussion: https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/22035/commits/70804c3df1144601c2695d528df10bec8be0c1ca

When you enter a datasource the `getSubscriptions` fails because `props.options.url` is not populated in the constructor. I've tried a few different approaches here and can't get it to update.

In the commit above, I override the url used to grab the subscriptions in `loadSubscriptions`. This works. At this point `props.options.url` is still empty.

However, if you click Load Subscriptions in the UI, it triggers `onLoadSubscriptions` -> `getSubscriptions` -> `loadSubscriptions`. After this chain, `props.options.url` is populated.

In addition, clicking Load Subscriptions will reset the datasources `readOnly` property to false enabling editing/deleting via the UI. This is not what you would want with provisioned datasources.

Maybe I've gone mad an am missing something obvious here

When this annotation query is saved, and we reload the dashboard, the `/api/annotations` call returns an empty list.

cards.title: Autogenerate thresholds for overrides based on regex

issue.title: Autogenerate thresholds for overrides based on regex
issue.body: Creating thresholds on a per-metric basis is tedious.  We should support matching a pattern that would be applied, with any "individual" override being the final setting.

events.body:
The plugin currently supports regex overrides but do not process them in an intuitive order - the first override matched is used, and the order of overrides cannot be changed.

Example:

with this override:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7364245/72024592-4fb5df80-323b-11ea-82b6-ec79e0efcc7e.png)

and this additional "specific" override

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7364245/72024633-69efbd80-323b-11ea-9eac-17615ee7fae4.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7364245/72024522-40369680-323b-11ea-904c-262433da1334.png)

The generated polygon for A-series should have "nofix" as the prefix, and not the regex match.

Another issue is that the overrides themselves are statically named "OVERRIDE N", and locating the correct override is tedious.

Three items to implement
- [ ] tooltip or replace names "OVERRIDE N" with pattern used in the override
- [ ] implement re-ordering of overrides
- [ ] detect regex in the match field, and skip the override if there is an exact match

A "preview" of metrics that are matched by an override inside the editor would be very useful (matched and used).  In the above example A-series would not appear inside "OVERRIDE 1" match preview since it is an exact match for "OVERRIDE 2"

cards.title: Code style (lint) improvements

issue.title: Code style (lint) improvements
issue.body:
Some of this will apply to the entire project, while some is isolated to the GitHub-labelled areas.

**What would you like to be added**:
1. [`require-await`](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/require-await) and [`no-return-await`](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-return-await) ESLint rules. This will need #16053.
2. Replace synchronous [`fs`](https://nodejs.org/api/fs.html) use with asynchronous.
3. Use `console.error()` for errors and `console.warn()` for warnings.

**Why is this needed**:
1. To avoid instances of `async () => await fn()`, which should be simplified to `() => fn()`.
2. Better (and consistent) code quality and the possibility of concurrency.
3. The right tool for the job, and coloured logging.

cards.title: Toolkit should better support ES6 imports

issue.title: Toolkit should better support ES6 imports

labels.name: priority/important-soon
labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.

issue.body:
In a plugin, we imported the ES6 module [countries-and-timezones](https://www.npmjs.com/package/countries-and-timezones)

This works fine on modern browsers, but old verions of Edge fail to load.

Toolkit should either:
* warn/fail saying you can't use ES6 module
* use babel to convert to ES5

events.body: Any thoughts on this @stevenvachon @dprokop ?  this has caused a pretty frantic morning with an enterprise customer

That library still [uses CommonJS modules](https://github.com/manuelmhtr/countries-and-timezones/blob/master/src/index.js#L56), but it does use some ES2015 features, such as `const`, `let` and "shorthand property names". The toolkit uses [@babel/preset-env](https://npmjs.com/@babel/preset-env) which, via its default configuration, is currently transpiling to support the ["last two versions" of popular browsers](https://github.com/browserslist/browserslist#full-list).

There're two problems here:
* ~~I don't think that dependency is to blame, as [Edge supports the above mentioned features](https://caniuse.com/#feat=mdn-javascript_grammar_shorthand_object_literals).~~
* We are not transpiling dependencies, which is a common best practice to avoid even longer build times.

I'd recommend creating a PR for the problematic dependency to have ES5 code published, either via a Babel build or by changing the source code.
Fixed in https://github.com/manuelmhtr/countries-and-timezones/pull/15

issue.body:
- [x]  Add a backend Query with DataFrames

**Resources**:
- [x] test
- [x] get fired alerts

- [x] get fields
- [x] get indexes
- [x] get metrics
- [x] get server status
- [x] cancel search job

**Query Features- Query Editor**
- [x] Namespace select - assembled into the query string
- [x] Index Select - assembled into the query string
- [x] Source Type - assembled into the query string
- [x] Metric Aggregates - assembled into the query string
model - alias, field, func
- [x] Split By - assembled into the query string
model - string array
- [x] Format As - this is needed on the front end - Time Series appends the settings below to the query

**Query Features - Time Series Options** 
These are all passed along in the query string when Time Series is selected (may want to hide them when not selected it's confusing)
- [x] Limit
- [x] Span
- [x] useother
- [x] usenull
- [x] continuous
- [x] partial
- [x] bins

**Datasource Features - Datasource Editor** (see [Features](https://github.com/grafana/splunk-datasource/blob/master/README.md))
- [x] One Shot Search -  exec_mode = "oneshot" -  that returns results quickly, no waiting
- [x] Synchronous Query - "normal query that waits"
- [x] Streaming - no waiting - polling for next results (experimental)
~~Live Streaming~~ - code exists to support this but nothing in the UI to toggle it (incomplete)
- [x] Polling 
- [x] Auto Cancel
- [x] Status Buckets
- [ ] Fields Search Mode - quick/full
- [ ] Default Earliest Time
- [ ] Variables Search Mode

**Query Options**
- [x] exec_mode - for one shot search?
- [x] search_mode = "realtime" - sets earliest_time and latest_time to "rt"
-- NOTE- this is for live streaming - there is no way currently to enable that in the UI
- [x] adhoc_search_level - what is this feature?

**Front End Tasks - wire up to backend changes (not react)**

- [x] GetApps/GetIndexes/GetSourceTYpes/GetFields/GetMetrics - use resources [Brian]
- [ ] GetFiredAlers - use resources
- [ ] AnnotationQuery
- [ ] MetricFindQuery
- [x] invokeAsyncSearch - this is actually a synchronous search (waits) - using QueryData now
- [x] invokeOneshotSearch
- [x] invokeSearchWithPreview
- [x] cancelSearchJob

issue.title: @grafana/toolkit - implement common tooling for plugin developers

repository.name: grafana
repository.description: The tool for beautiful monitoring and metric analytics & dashboards for Graphite, InfluxDB & Prometheus & More

issue.body:
The work started in: https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/17445

TODO: 
- [x] Enable building app/plugin using shared rollup config
- [x] If there is more than one module.ts entry then add manual chunks
- [x] Enable running tests on app/plugin
- [x] Introduce common tsconfig
- [x] Introduce common tslint config
- [x] Do not expose internal cli commands 
- [x] Validate plugin name/org
       - OK for plugins in grafana repo to skip the org 
- [x] Run typecheck before linting 
- [x] Add watch option to enable easy development (rollup watch, plugin:[dev|watch])


## Areas to cover

### Plugin development tasks
- [x] `grafana-toolkit plugin:test` - performs tests for a given plugin
- [x] `grafana-toolkit plugin:dev` - runs plugin in development mode, meaning that Rollup is run in `watch` mode
- [x] `grafana-toolkit plugin:build` - prepares plugin distribution package
  - [x] Runs linter
  - [x] Runs tests
  - [x] Bundles plugin
- [x] `grafana-toolkit plugin:create` - creates plugin seed from a template (https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/18506)

### Testing plugin
- [x] Make sure toolkit allows working with enzyme/react-testing-library
- [x] Enable custom Jest config (via package.json file as a start)
- [x] Enable running test task in watch mode (https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/18137)
- [x] run a single test from command line (@briangann) (https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/18137)

### Linting / Prettier
- [x] Enable linting plugin via `tslint`
  - [x] Enable lint fix in `plugin:dev` (https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/18131)
- [x] Enable custom tslint config
- [x] Prettier (https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/17964)
  - [x] Enable Prettier check in 'plugin:build'
  - [x] Enable Prettier write in 'plugin:dev' (https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/18131)

### Bundling plugin
- [x] Verifies if plugin follows common practices 
  - [x] Check if plugin.json naming follows naming convention (#17975)
- [x] Bundles plugin using Webpack
- [x] CSS generation
- [x] Show webpack stats after build is finished (both `plugin:dev` and  `plugin:build`) (https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/18138)

~~### Documentation~~
- ~~generate docs from `/docs` folder~~
 a different task should do this


### CircleCI helpers
package a plugin in circleci.  this will be super helpful for backend plugins.

See: #17967


### Plugin stylesheet (#17938)
- [x] Add support for common conventions:
  - [x] Single css/scss file (used via import)
  - [x] Separate files for themes (used via loadPluginCss)
  - [x] Emotion
- [x] Enable PostCSS
- [x] Verify SASS setup

With new react panels, we should push for emotion.  However we still need to support old/existing panels that tend to either just [import a .css file](https://github.com/grafana/clock-panel/blob/master/src/clock_ctrl.ts#L5), or use: [loadPluginCss](https://github.com/grafana/kubernetes-app/blob/master/src/module.ts#L10)
```
loadPluginCss({
  dark: 'plugins/grafana-kubernetes-app/css/dark.css',
  light: 'plugins/grafana-kubernetes-app/css/light.css'
});
```

## v2 backlog:
- [ ] Make Enzyme a default test tool in toolkit
- [x] `plugin:ci` - gather stats from webpack task

## Current (known) problems to be figured out
1. **How to handle imports from core?** `import XXX from 'app/plugins/sdk'`
This problem surfaced in k8s and ajax panel. Can't see any clear path how to fight this one. Problem is that those plugins import implementations from core (indirectyl, via pligins/sdk). It's not about interfaces anymore but about actual implementations being extended by apps/plugins. Thing is that we possibly could extract app/plugins/sdk to a separate package, i.e. `@grafana/plugin-sdk`, but it's super hard because of app/plugins/sdk referencing core modules.... Crap 


Toolkit wishlist:
* prettier fix (in dev)
* test <single test file> ask @brian.gann
* external/lib support.  Include, but don't compile:
  https://github.com/grafana/grafana-polystat-panel/blob/use-toolkit/src/d3wrapper.ts#L1
* enzyme out-of-the-box

cards.title: Query input unusable for long queries

issue.title: Query input unusable for long queries
issue.body:
Long queries may not fit in the query input, in that case they wrap but there is no way to make the query input larger.  It should gracefully handle queries that don't fit on one line.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443603/55511244-1908c400-562e-11e9-95b6-1db49dbba771.png)

events.body: the latest update (not release yet) doesn't exhibit this behavior. it will expand as a line wraps, and even accepts a ctrl-enter for a newline.

Guess we should confirm that this is indeed the case (as Brian has indicated)?
Perhaps adding a screenshot? Sending to "Investigation"
